Section.name: Introduction
Section.Title: Lifecycle Document Project Manager with Requirements Tracking
Section.Para: The goal of this project is to create a protoype application capable of allowing a user to productively manage lifecycle documentation in XML without a previous XML experience.

Requirement.Title: Brief Descriptio
Requirement.Para: User is presented with the option to create a Lifecycle project, or new document within an existing project. The user only needs to input a name, location, and template selection.

Requirement.Title: Preconditions
Requirement.Para: The user has started the program.
A valid template has been selected.

Requirement.Title: Basic Flow of Events
Requirement.Para: User selects create.
Name, location, and template are input.
Templates are copied to the given location using the name specified.
Read method is called

Requirement.Title: Alternate Flows
Requirement.Para: If creating a document within an existing project, location is already specified.

Requirement.Title: Sub Flows
Requirement.Para: Documents are checked against schema for initial integrity.

Requirement.Title: Post Conditions
Requirement.Para: Project directory is created.
Project file is created containing meta-data and additional project file locations.

Requirement.Title: Specific Requirements
Requirement.Para: User is unaware of XML back end implementation
All hardware interfacing is handled by the browser
Must work with Internet Explorer 10
Must communicate with local file system to create and edit XML files

Requirement.Title: Brief Description
Requirement.Para: User selects to open a LC document in a read-only format. A file system search is opened.

Requirement.Title: Preconditions
Requirement.Para: The document to be opened must already exist and match the XML schema.

Requirement.Title: Basic Flow of Events
Requirement.Para: Open LC document is clicked.
User is prompted with search of file system.
User selects LC project
LC document is opened in a read-only mode.

Requirement.Title: Alternate Flows
Requirement.Para: User could open file which does not match XML schema â†’prompted with error.
User can click on the read-only document and enable an editing mode.
User can switch tabs which will open a different document within the project.

Requirement.Title: Sub Flows
Requirement.Para: Documents are checked against schema for integrity

Requirement.Title: Post Conditions
Requirement.Para: Document is opened in read-only mode until user clicks on section to be edited.

Requirement.Title: Specific Requirements
Requirement.Para: User is unaware of XML back end implementation
System shall present a GUI to users that allow them to develop and edit lifecycle documents (i.e Requirements, Design, and Test)
Must work with Internet Explorer 10
System shall produce XML instances conformant with an XML schema designed and developed by the team.
Must communicate with local file system to create and edit XML files

Requirement.Title: Additional Information
Requirement.Para: Not applicable at this time.

Requirement.Title: Brief Description
Requirement.Para: User selects a section from the Table of Contents. This section is focused in the preview and put into an editable text area.

Requirement.Title: Preconditions
Requirement.Para: A LC project has been opened and checked against the given schema.
Table of Contents and preview have been generated and displayed.

Requirement.Title: Basic Flow of Events
Requirement.Para: User selects a section from the Table of Contents
This section is focused and made editable
User makes changes and selects another section or exits
User is prompted to save any changes.

Requirement.Title: Alternate Flows
Requirement.Para: No changes are made

Requirement.Title: Sub Flows
Requirement.Para: Changes are committed to local file

Requirement.Title: Post Conditions
Requirement.Para: If files are changed, they still match schema

Requirement.Title: Specific Requirements
Requirement.Para: User is unaware of XML back end implementation
System shall present a GUI to users that allow them to develop and edit lifecycle documents (i.e Requirements, Design, and Test)
Ability to view existing requirements, design elements and test cases shall be available at all times
All hardware interfacing is handled by the browser
Must work with Internet Explorer 10
Must communicate with local file system to create and edit XML files

Requirement.Title: Additional Information
Requirement.Para: Not applicable at this time.

Requirement.Title: Brief Description
Requirement.Para: LC Document will be exported as an HTML file using the XSLT processor based on the defined XML schema.

Requirement.Title: Preconditions
Requirement.Para: XML Schema is defined.
LC Document contains text.

Requirement.Title: Basic Flow of Events
Requirement.Para: XML Schema is defined.
LC Document is opened and being viewed/edited.
User clicks Export LC Document.
User is prompted for name of file to be exported.
XSLT processor uses XML schema to create HTML file.

Requirement.Title: Alternate Flows
Requirement.Para: User can be asked which export file format is appropriate.
User can choose between HTML and PDF.

Requirement.Title: Sub Flows
Requirement.Para: Documents are checked against schema for integrity.

Requirement.Title: Post Conditions
Requirement.Para: HTML file is exported and viewable in browser.

Requirement.Title: Specific Requirements
Requirement.Para: System shall present a GUI to users that allow them to develop and edit lifecycle documents (i.e Requirements, Design, and Test)
All hardware interfacing is handled by the browser
Must work with Internet Explorer 10
Program should be capable of running XSLT processing for HTML and PDF output.
An XML instance shall be transformed, via XSLT designed and developed by the team into an HTML-based interactive document
Must communicate with local file system to create and edit XML files

Requirement.Title: Additional Information
Requirement.Para: Not applicable at this time.

Requirement.Title: Brief Description
Requirement.Para: A RTM should be generated from the requirements, use cases, and test cases within a project. This will be displayed as an HTML table while giving the user the ability to download it as a CSV.

Requirement.Title: Preconditions
Requirement.Para: An project is open and the documents follow a given schema

Requirement.Title: Basic Flow of Events
Requirement.Para: User clicks generate RTM
Requirements document is scanned, assigning an ID to each requirement for easy navigation
Use and test case documents are scanned for these requirements
Found instances are noted on table
HTML and CSV are generated and displayed

Requirement.Title: Alternate Flows
Requirement.Para: If the desired document does not exist, those cells will be left blank

Requirement.Title: Sub Flows
Requirement.Para: CSV is generated from table
If button is pressed, download is presented to user

Requirement.Title: Post Conditions
Requirement.Para: None

Requirement.Title: Specific Requirements
Requirement.Para: User is unaware of XML back end implementation
System shall present a GUI to users that allow them to develop and edit lifecycle documents (i.e Requirements, Design, and Test)
Must work with Internet Explorer 10
System shall produce XML instances conformant with an XML schema designed and developed by the team.
System shall be able to auto-generate a Requirements Traceability Matrix at any point during development
Must communicate with local file system to create and edit XML files

Requirement.Title: Additional Information
Requirement.Para: Not applicable at this time.
